script: Safety, security, comfort, all in the gentle caress of a finger.
Or the brush of lips on a soft cheek.
It connects us when we're happy.
It bolsters us in times of fear… excites us in times of passion… and love.
We need that touch from the one we love, almost as much as we need her to breathe.
But I never understood the importance of touch.
Actually, though, the tan lines might be incredible.
Oh, my gosh, That doesn't even cover half your boobs.
No. You need something… -This is actually cute. -Ooh. That's actually really cute.
I can't tell if you're, like, too trampy, or not trampy enough.
Taylor and Mason are meeting us at the airport in the morning.
I wish I could be there to see that in person.
Just sucks that you planned it this year and you don't even get to go.
Well… you can just Photoshop me in with your fancy editing apps.
-You're not laughing. -You know what I'm talking about.
The one where you get your pimples and your little… -What? -Mm-hmm.
The lashes… Your lashes aren't that ling, really.
Honestly, you guys are gonna have so much fun.
I'm back in the hospital, again, for another tune-up.
Need a few more rounds of antibiotics to get over this little sore throat that I've been… Hi, Barbs!
Sore throat? Right. With a 102 fever.
Stella, get that thing out of my face.
Well, Stella will be right back after we get her al set up.
I think this is her best work.
Wow. Wow, a lot's changed in the last six months.
You are all set. I'll see you in a bit.
Are you sure this is okay?
I will still be monitoring you. And, yes… it's okay.
What would I do without you?
So, Barb is letting me keep my med cart in my room this time.
She left me a bunch of pills.
That's the liquid nutrition that goes straight to my stomach through my G-tube.
wishing you could eat 5,000 calories a day and not gain a pound, I'll trade you any day.
Today, I'll probably be re-organizing this thing.
Because as many of you know, I'm slightly anal.
By slightly anal, I mean clinically OCD.
so unless you plant your ass on that call button, no one's gonna bother you for, like, an hour.
Hey. I gotta sleep on that bed, okay?
Wow. I mean, we're not animals.
Don't worry, it's not even gonna take that long.
Saw you moving in your stuff.
There was, uh, a lot of it.
You gonna be here for a while?
Shouldn't you be procuring your room for your guests?
You rent by the hour or what?
So that was you lurking in the hall.
Mm, I don't lurk and you followed me here.
I wanted to introduce myself, but… -that little attitude of yours… -Let me guess.
You're the kind of guy that ignores the rules 'cause it makes you feel in control. Am I right?
Letting your friends borrow your room for sex is disgusting, so no.
Fine isn't exactly a ringing endorsement, but I'll take some common ground where I can get it.
-We have nothing in common. -Oh, that's cold.
Six feet at all times. You both know the rules.
Will, get back to your room.
A little name for your psychological profile.
It'll be over before you know it.
Part of a new drug trial for Cevaflomalin.
You contract that and you can… you can kiss the possibility of new lungs goodbye.
There's no coming back from that bacteria.
Okay, AffloVest for thirty more minutes, then you're all set.
You need anything else before I hit the road?
Oh, so what, I'm room service now?
which doesn't necessarily mean I'm gonna die tomorrow, but I could die tomorrow. Anyone could die tomorrow.
I just have a little bit less time than everyone else.
My lungs are at about fifty percent function right now.
So at this rate, Doctor Hamid says that I'll need a transplant by the time I'm a junior in high school.
We're at the NICU because I'm obsessed with babies.
…the beautiful Barb is giving me permission to come in here by myself now.
Cystic fibrosis, as you know, is a genetic disease that basically makes my body produce a shit ton of mucus.
Fun fact, I have to be extremely careful around other people with CF.
The rule is that we're not supposed to get within six feet because we could end up catching each other's bacteria.

A lot of people don't realize that new lungs generally only last about five years, which is okay, actually, because most of us are just trying to stay alive long enough for a new treatment to come out.
Hi, guys. Just chilling here in my new AffloVest, which is really cool because now I don't have to be hooked up to the wall, which obviously I'm not, because I'm hanging upside down on my bed.
This is actually good for getting the mucus up and stuff.
Are those truffles? How'd you get truffles?
Look at how spicy that food cart is.
Maybe he broke up with me.
Why? You actually really liked him.
And I thought he was gonna be the one.
At least you got to do that.
I'm sorry, Julie. My legs hit the call button.
so we need to be patient and Will needs to help us with that.
The risk of cross infection will be even higher now, so… Don't cough on any other CFers.
Well, don't get close enough to touch them for their safety and yours.
Will, in order for this to work, you need to keep up with your regimen.
Okay, well, I will see you soon.
Oh, I'm officially jealous. That looks so fun!
I miss you too, You have any cute boy visitors?
What are you doing? Do you have a death wish or something?
Hey. My lungs are toast, okay?
Can you…? Just let me enjoy this view while I can.
Do you know how lucky you are to be here?
How do you know about my drug trial?
If you don't care, then leave.
Give your spot to someone else.
Someone that, that wants it, that wants to live.
Come on, it was a joke.
Where's your med cart? And your pills, and… why's your AffloVest vest on the floor? Can… Can I see your regimen?
Um… not that it's any of your business.
Is this what an aneurysm looks like?
Look, I get that you have some kind of save-the-world hero complex going on, but can you leave me out of it?
No, that's probably why they keep shoving 'em them down my throat.
I need you to follow your regimen strictly and completely, please.
Why don't… Why don't you tell me what's going on? Actually.
And I need to know that things are in order, and I know that you're not doing your treatments and it's really, really messing me up.
Okay, I wanna help you. I do.
I don't even know how to do what you're asking me to.
All CFers know how to administer their own treatments.
We're practically doctors by the time we're twelve.
Am I actually messing you up?
But if I do… what's in it for me?
No, not like… I… I wanna draw you.
You really can't practice just a little bit of discipline even to save your own life?
Stella, nothing is going to save our lives.
But I'm not posing for hours on end.
And your regimen, we're doing it my way.
Okay, the first thing you're gonna do is get a med cart in your room. Deal?
Well, there's no better place to break a leg.
So no lung transplant for me.
Colonized so quickly. I was on the transplant list one minute and then… I'm sure that attitude is what's giving Stella fits.
She told me that she has control issues or something.
Call it what you want, she's got her shit together. She definitely keeps me in line.
So, uh… Are you two… No, no, no.
I've known that girl since I was, like, seven.
So why haven't you done anything about it?
Don't worry. I don't like white boys.
Doctor Hamid said that you suddenly wanna be responsible for your own regimen.
Yes. This wasn't my idea, you know?
Okay. your med cart's all set up.
I built an app for chronic illnesses.
It'll alert you when to do your treatments, -and to take your pills… -Built an app?
It's pretty simple. You should be able to figure it out.
Don't tell me that the one time you're interested in some guy, he's a CFer.
I just helped him set up his med cart.
I know you, Stella. Organizing a med cart is like foreplay.
You're supposed to be doing your AffloVest right now and did you take your Creon?
Okay, I can't trust you, so… this is how it's gonna work. We're gonna do our treatments together so that way I know you're actually doing them. Okay?
Always looking for ways to spend more time with me, aren't you, Stella?
I've been doing this since I was a little kid.
So you just pour them all in the pudding and stir it around.
Divorce Diet doesn't look good on you, Mom.
You're too thin. Dad needs a bath. You guys are stealing my look.
Okay, maybe I need this more than you do.
How did it happen? Oh, man.
I don't know what I'd do without you.
Let's try some Bactroban, see how it looks in a day or two.
Maybe we can clear it up, huh?
Oh, I'll be at the gym.
When does this deal of our become mutually beneficial?
I've done everything you've asked with no return on my investment.
You really wanna draw me after we work out?
No. I'm gross and sweaty and smell.
Fine. I'll sweat harder then. Just for you.
Pretty old-fashioned for someone who builds apps.
Yeah, well, the app doesn't give me the satisfaction of doing… that.
What else is on that to-do list of yours?
My master list or my daily list?
Yeah, of course you have two lists.
Well, the master list. That's the big stuff, right?
Okay. Volunteer in an important political campaign.
Study all the works of William Shakespeare. Done.
Share everything I know about CF with other people. That's my YouTube page.
so that you can join the debate team of the dead or something?
But, uh… sex in the Vatican.
Uh, I'd rather have painting with Bob Ross.
I'd like to travel the world.
Actually get to see some of it and not… the inside of these hospitals.
Okay. I just thought you might want to know how this feels. You ready?
I love you, Stella. I'll see you soon.
I like seeing you like this.
They can be light and funny but pack a powerful punch.
I think a well-drawn cartoon can say a lot more than words ever could.
A lot more than words ever could.
I think it's actually pretty good.
I think that's really good behind you.
Oh, those are lungs. That's brilliant.
Uh, no. My older sister Abby.
I'd love to see more of her stuff. Do you have any?
We don't have to, uh, share our stories, okay?
We can just do our treatments together.
Hey, guys! I have to get a nasal poly… Polypectomy. We're removing polyps from your nasal passages.
But I'm gonna be there to sing her to sleep. Just like always.
But seriously… I'm gonna be there when you go to sleep and I'm gonna be right here when you wake up.
My sister, Abby, ladies and gentlemen.
-She's single, by the way. -Okay. Stop it.
Abby's not in any of the videos after that.
I mean, it's mostly art, her and Stella, but you're right.
I mean, she hasn't posted in, like, a year.
Barb didn't see you come in, did she?
You're as delicate as a jackhammer.
We don't have time for delicacy, Stella. We're dying.
Can you stop reminding me that I'm dying?
I've been dying my whole life.
Every birthday, we celebrated it like it was my last one.
And then my parents' marriage died.
And it was supposed to be me.
Everyone was ready for that. Everyone was prepared for that.
I just-- My parents… I can't.
Is this why you're so obsessed with your regimen?
Will… You're a sick girl with survivor's guilt.
-This is out of your control. -Look, look. I… -This has never been-- -Will, I just don't have any other choice.
We're supposed to be medita-- Stella, come on!
For what it's worth, I don't think he meant to hurt you.
Like, he said Abby and dead in the same sentence like it was no big deal.
Oh, this disease is a prison.
Just pretend that I'm doing it right now.
You're right. I don't. It's risky.
But sepsis is the bigger monster.
You're a fighter, Stella Grant. You always have been.
I'm here. I got your cartoon. You're forgiven. Back up.
You missed our treatment. What's going on?
Dr. Hamid's worried about sepsis, so she's replacing it in the morning.
Are your lungs up for that?
Do your nebulizer at eight, and your AffloVest, okay?
I thought this was the bathroom, honestly.
It's your first surgery without Abby.
Some might say I'm your biggest fan.
So, I really hope that I don't mess this up.
My grandma used to sing that to us.
I had to Google it. It's really old.
You ready to get this show on the road?
i just wanted to do something nice.
She's in more danger under the anesthesia than she is with me.
Trevor Von That's who you remind me of. Trevor Von and Amy Presley.
Oh, they were… they were in love.
And I let them break the rules so they could be happy.
And I'd be damned if I let that happen again.
Call me, 'cause… i miss you, okay?
But don't call me, 'cause I just got out of surgery and I'm really tired.
But call me, though, when you get this because… you're cute.
and your fluffy, little hair, and your little, skinny legs.
Don't call me, though, because… if I hear your sexy voice, I won't be able to sleep, so… Call me when you get this, okay?
I'm not leaving until you open the door.
Just please open the door and we can talk about this. Okay?
I don't care what Barb said. Just open the door!
We don't get to take chances like this.
Oh, come on. You're not gonna give me that, too?
Will's a risk taker, just like Abby.
You think that I'm the one that's afraid to take risks?
What about you and your life and… your relationships?
You and Tim, you and Rick, -you and Michael. -Don't go there.
They knew you were sick and they loved you.
You were the one who ran. Every time, you ran.
You don't know what you're talking about.
You ruined every chance you've ever had at love, so just keep your advice to yourself.
You know what someone gets for loving me?
They get to pay for all my care.
And then they get to watch me die.
When I turn eighteen, there's no more full coverage.
Who should I put that on?
It's my sickness, it's my problem.
Maybe we can get Will to marry you. He's loaded.
He's not picky. He likes you.
There is something a little bit different I want to talk about today.
The risks, the restrictions, and the rules of engagement.
B. cepacia is a hardy bacteria.
Okay, it is so adaptive that it literally feeds on penicillin.
So, our first line of defense is Cal Stat, a hospital-grade hand sterilizer.
Tried-and-true. Used for protection in all types of activities.
B. cepacia thrives best in saliva or phlegm.
Fun fact, a cough can travel six feet, a sneeze can travel up to two-hundred miles per hour. But, the no saliva thing also means no kissing.
So our best defense is distance.
I've given a lot of thought to foot number six.
And, you know what? It made me mad.
When you have cystic fibrosis, so much is taken from you.
You live every day of your life according to treatments, and pills, and schedules.
Most of us can't have children.
A lot of us don't even live long enough to try to have children.
Shit, it's complicated to try to explain, but… it's even hard to fall in love.
So, after all that CF has stolen from me, from us, I don't mind stealing a little something back.
One fucking foot of space, of distance, of length or whatever you wanna call it.
I don't mind stealing that back.
Because CF… you're not the thief anymore. I'm the thief now.
Why didn't I pack anything nice?
Oh, 'cause you always pack for a hot hospital romance.
Don't even think about it, ho.
I guess having a sick kid wasn't part of his plan.
She's beautiful and driven and smart.
She's just focused on me and me alone.
So, starting tomorrow when I'm eighteen, I will be making the decisions for myself.
You could've told me that. I don't have a present for you.
How about you just promise to stick around for the next one?
There is this one theory I like that says to understand death, you have to look at birth.
So, like, while we're in the womb, we're living that existence, not knowing that our next existence is just an inch away.
So, maybe it's the same with death.
Maybe death is just the next life, but an inch away.
Or maybe it's just the big sleep, baby.
No, there's no way that Abby just blinked out.
She was cliff diving in California.
She landed wrong, broke her neck and drowned.
They said she didn't feel any pain, but… how would they know if she felt pain?
But i got sick like I always do.
I just keep imagining it over and over again.
Without knowing that, she just never stops dying.
Stella. Even if you were there, you still wouldn't know.
Isn't that how we're gonna die?
Our own fluids doing the dirty work.
I think about that last breath a lot.
Otherwise, I don't swell on it.
I wish I could touch you.
I've never wanted anyone to see me. The scars, the… The tube. Nothing about it is sexy.
Abby and I would call them stars… She'd never tell me what her wish was, but… I knew she wished for new lungs for me.
I hope she gets her wish.
Oh, shit. Barb knows we're gone.
-Okay. -Uh… Uh, she'll look for me first in the NICU, so… Bye. Okay.
Happy birthday. I'm so sorry I forgot.
No, it's fine. What're you doing? Are you busy? Let's take a walk.
My friends are actually coming later.
No, it's all right. We'll figure something out.
Yeah, no. Don't, no, don't worry about it. It's fine.
It's fine. Just do your thing.
Uh, we had to wait until the cafeteria closed.
We felt so bad for ditching you, dude.
But your girlfriend DM'd us and convinced us to surprise you.
And he's even hotter in person.
Just wanted to observe the master at work.
They're so beautiful. How do you do that?
'Cause next month, Michael and I are gonna go see my mom.
He's coming to lunch tomorrow and I'm gonna go for it.
Oh, Poe. I'm so… -I'm so happy. -Don't go all sloppy on me.
You know I can't let a girl cry alone.
Poe, where did you get all of this?
Hospitals have VIP kitchens where they keep all the good stuff.
You know, for celebrities, politicians. But tonight, Birthday Boy, it's for you.
Yes. And we literally put sheets over our head and ran into the dementia ward!
It was the best Halloween ever!
We got in so much trouble.
And it wasn't even our idea. Remember? Abby. Abby came up with that.
She always said she was gonna live big because Stella couldn't.
She would've loved a clandestine party like this one!
I can't blow the candles out or else you guys can't eat it.
You want us to fix you a plate?
You're all confined to your rooms while we get respiratory cultures.
And, you. You'll be transferred in the morning.
Barb! Barb, it wasn't his fault.
Well, you might be willing to gamble with your lives, but I'm not!
Just like when we were kids.
But you're not kids anymore, Poe.
But we were safe like you taught us to be.
I'm sorry, but it was fun!
It's just safer if he goes.
He probably sat on the call button again. I got it.
He's not breathing. He's not breathing.
Come on, sweetie. Come on, sweetie.
Somebody get her out of here! Close that door!
Michael's never gonna see him again. His parents are never gonna see him again.
I never hugged him! He's my best friend and I never fucking hugged him!
I wanna go see the lights.
It's gotta be, like, two miles away.
-Hey, come on. Let's go inside. -I'm going.
Stella, now's not the time to be rebellious.
It's about Abby, it's about you and me, and all the things that we'll never get to do together.
This whole time I've been living for my treatments instead of doing my treatments so that I can live.
I wanna live. It's just life, Will. It'll be over before we know it.
Can we catch a cab at least?
I wanna walk and enjoy the night.
How are you always getting me to exercise?
Yeah, you're gonna have to explain that one.
Abby got it for me the first time I came to the hospital.
I've had it with me every time since.
That's a relief, honestly, because I didn't have the heart to tell you that a third boob might be a deal breaker.
Come on. Let's go see your lights.
I just got a call from St. Luke's in Kansas City.
Car accident with fatalities. One female, AB neg, five foot two, thoracic cage size is… Get her prepped.
No, no, no, no, no, no, no.
Barb, Barb, Barb… She's not answering and now it's going straight to voicemail.
But Stella would never run off. She wouldn't do that.
Have you been able to reach him?
-Don't you dare tell me… -This is Will's mother.
How long have they been gone?
-At least an hour. -If your son -causes Stella to lose these lungs… -My son is just as sick as your daughter is.
Stella would never do anything like this. She's never done anything like this.
Stella did this, Erin, not Will.
He doesn't know anything about the lungs.
-Yes. -Yeah, for Stella. They're on the way.
I owned a ferret. I was a ferret kid.
Oh, no. You would be a ferret kid.
-Really, what do they need… -It's my mom.
-Yeah, but just… -Let me just tell her that I'm okay.
Stella, they have new lungs for you.
Hey, they have new lungs for you. Let's go to the hospital. Come on.
I haven't seen the lights yet.
The lights. Did you know about this?
What are we doing out here? Let's go to the hospital. Come on.
-Years? -That's the shelf-life of… Five years is a lifetime -for people like us. -It's not!
-Let's not be stupid. -When they fail… -Can we go to the hospital, please? -…I'm back to square one.
-Come on, let's go. -Will? Will… Stella! Stella?
We already have lungs for her.
-Can someone get the other mask on? -Oh, my god. Oh, my god.
My son! My son was out there too!
We're gonna need more blankets in here.
We have your new lungs in the other… -Yes. Stella. -I don't want them.
Stella, we've been waiting for these lungs for years.
We don't use the lungs, they're wasted, sweetie.
I love him. The new lungs won't mean anything without him.
Okay? I love you so much.
I gave her mouth to mouth.
I'm sorry, I didn't have any other choice.
If she has B. cepacia, we'll deal with it, okay?
I don't know how, but she's clean.
But that doesn't mean she won't.
What? What is it? What is it, honey?
Could you help me with something?
She's sedated. We have a few more hours.
I guess it's true. What that book of yours says.
That the soul knows no time.
But I want you to know that this past month will last forever for me.
My only regret is that you didn't get to see your lights.
You know, people are always saying if you love something you have to learn to let it go.
I thought that was such bullshit.
Till I watched you almost die.
In that moment, Stella, nothing mattered to me.
All I want is to be with you.
I can't I need you to be safe.
i don't know what comes next.
But I don't regret any of this.
I just don't know if I could walk away with you still looking at me.
Safety, security, comfort all in the gentle caress of a finger.
Or at the brush of lips on a soft cheek.
It connects us when we're happy.
Bolsters us in times of fear.
Excites us in times of passion.
We need that touch from the one we love almost as much as we need air to breathe.
But I never understood the importance of touch.
So, if you're watching this, and you're able, Touch him.
Life's too short to waste a second.
